verses.verse: ( The Day the Sun Stood Still) וַיְהִי֩ <WH1961> way·hî Now כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ <WH8085> ḵiš·mō·a‘ heard אֲדֹֽנִי־ <WH139> ’ă·ḏō·nî- vvv צֶ֜דֶק <WH139> ṣe·ḏeq Adoni-zedek מֶ֣לֶךְ <WH4428> me·leḵ king יְרוּשָׁלִַ֗ם <WH3389> yə·rū·šā·lim of Jerusalem כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- that לָכַ֨ד <WH3920> lā·ḵaḏ had captured יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ <WH3091> yə·hō·wō·šu·a‘ Joshua אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הָעַי֮ <WH5857> hā·‘ay Ai וַיַּחֲרִימָהּ֒ <WH2763> way·ya·ḥă·rî·māh and devoted it to destruction — ( Forms of the Hebrew cherem refer to the giving over of things or persons to the LORD, either by destroying them or by giving them as an offering; also in verses 28, 35, 37, 39, and 40.) כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר <WH834> ka·’ă·šer as עָשָׂ֤ה <WH6213> ‘ā·śāh doing to לִֽירִיחוֹ֙ <WH3405> lî·rî·ḥōw Jericho וּלְמַלְכָּ֔הּ <WH4428> ū·lə·mal·kāh and its king כֵּן־ <WH3651> kên- ... עָשָׂ֥ה <WH6213> ‘ā·śāh he had done to לָעַ֖י <WH5857> lā·‘ay Ai וּלְמַלְכָּ֑הּ <WH4428> ū·lə·mal·kāh and its king — וְכִ֨י <WH3588> wə·ḵî and that הִשְׁלִ֜ימוּ <WH7999> hiš·lî·mū had made peace יֹשְׁבֵ֤י <WH3427> yō·šə·ḇê the people גִבְעוֹן֙ <WH1391> ḡiḇ·‘ō·wn of Gibeon אֶת־ <WH854> ’eṯ- with יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl Israel וַיִּֽהְי֖וּ <WH1961> way·yih·yū and were [living] בְּקִרְבָּֽם׃ <WH7130> bə·qir·bām near them.

וַיִּֽירְא֣וּ <WH3372> way·yî·rə·’ū alarmed, מְאֹ֔ד <WH3966> mə·’ōḏ So [Adoni-zedek and his people] were greatly כִּ֣י <WH3588> kî because עִ֤יר <WH5892> ‘îr city, גְּדוֹלָה֙ <WH1419> gə·ḏō·w·lāh [was] a great גִּבְע֔וֹן <WH1391> giḇ·‘ō·wn Gibeon כְּאַחַ֖ת <WH259> kə·’a·ḥaṯ like one עָרֵ֣י <WH5892> ‘ā·rê cities; הַמַּמְלָכָ֑ה <WH4467> ham·mam·lā·ḵāh of the royal וְכִ֨י <WH3588> wə·ḵî ... הִ֤יא <WH1931> hî it גְדוֹלָה֙ <WH1419> ḡə·ḏō·w·lāh was larger מִן־ <WH4480> min- than הָעַ֔י <WH5857> hā·‘ay Ai, וְכָל־ <WH3605> wə·ḵāl and all אֲנָשֶׁ֖יהָ <WH582> ’ă·nā·še·hā its men גִּבֹּרִֽים׃ <WH1368> gib·bō·rîm were mighty.

וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח <WH7971> way·yiš·laḥ sent אֲדֹנִי־ <WH139> ’ă·ḏō·nî- vvv צֶ֜דֶק <WH139> ṣe·ḏeq Therefore Adoni-zedek מֶ֣לֶךְ <WH4428> me·leḵ king יְרוּשָׁלִַ֗ם <WH3389> yə·rū·šā·lim of Jerusalem אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- word to הוֹהָ֣ם <WH1944> hō·w·hām Hoham מֶֽלֶךְ־ <WH4428> me·leḵ- king חֶ֠בְרוֹן <WH2275> ḥeḇ·rō·wn of Hebron, וְאֶל־ <WH413> wə·’el- ... פִּרְאָ֨ם <WH6502> pir·’ām Piram מֶֽלֶךְ־ <WH4428> me·leḵ- king יַרְמ֜וּת <WH3412> yar·mūṯ of Jarmuth, וְאֶל־ <WH413> wə·’el- ... יָפִ֧יעַ <WH3309> yā·p̄î·a‘ Japhia מֶֽלֶךְ־ <WH4428> me·leḵ- king לָכִ֛ישׁ <WH3923> lā·ḵîš of Lachish, וְאֶל־ <WH413> wə·’el- ... דְּבִ֥יר <WH1688> də·ḇîr and Debir מֶֽלֶךְ־ <WH4428> me·leḵ- king עֶגְל֖וֹן <WH5700> ‘eḡ·lō·wn of Eglon, לֵאמֹֽר׃ <WH559> lê·mōr saying,
